reviews.review_msg: I have to admit, I was skeptical when I saw him, but Dr. Menzies is hilarious and engaging. Can't believe he got bad reviews. Rob's the best! His lectures are really interesting and I actually enjoy the group discussions, whereas usually I'd rather die than discuss in groups. I love his teaching style. Can't wait to take more classes with him!

such a easy prof, have to attend lecture because all notes are verbal, exams are easy all based on lecture, no use of textbook only used for his mini paper! lots of in class presentations with groups! cumulative exams, but really easy. Come to class and you will do fine! took him two times

Menzies is clearly very passionate about what he covers in class, but this course was just terrible. There are a ridiculous number of readings per week which are unnecessarily long and confusing. The entire class is article based. I took it thinking it sounds interesting and may even be an easy A to boost up my GPA, but I was completely wrong.

I really liked Menzies and though his teaching was a little dry, he encouraged discussion and seemed passionate about the material. However, the class itself was article-based, and in order to well on the final you would have had to read 40+ long academic articles. Ridiculous. It's the lowest mark on my transcript.. Good luck

Horrible class. Article based class with 3 to 4 articles per week which he does not really go over because students are teaching and presenting them. Things he teaches only support a fraction of the final.

Rob is the best prof ive ever had. He is dedicated to helping students he is brilliant and everything he makes you read is so interesting. I go an A in his course and it wasnt too hard to achieve. He is literally amazing. I cant say enough good things. Dont believe his bad reviews, Great assignments great marking very very good prof.

This prof is completely useless. The students have to teach his material in presentations every week. Wednesday classes are a waste of time since there is only one final and it is all based on students presentations... How stupid is that. There was no point in coming to class other then discussion. Papers are marked fairly. Talks like a clown.
Great prof. He was insightful and very dedicated to his work. He could speak a bit slower but everything is in such a dramatized manner that you can't help but stay entertained

awesome prof! pretty nice and helpful to students. he makes an effort to make class fun and even though his jokes are not always as funny as he intends them to be. its sweet. he knows everything about sociology! he can talk and talk about it all day long if we let him. it definitely shows that he cares about his students! would take him again

interesting fun teacher, but dont skip out on the videos as they're on the final.  And the final is super hard even though he gives u some of the questions.  This man knows his stuff inside and ou t. know yours. papers are fair but his final is f'd up. pure memorization on the final.

He knows the material for the course (Citizenship and Social Justice) extremely well. If you ever have a question, he'll give you an essay of an answer! Very helpful and willing to spend the extra time to make sure all students understand what he is talking about. His marking is fair. If you put the effort into the course then you will do well.
pretty good class, dont expect any help from him though, he will tell you know with a great big smile on his face which is really irritating

definitely a study in mental disorder himself in some ways, with strange voices and endless babble. Don't kid yourself though, he knows this subject INSIDE out, and is a very tough marker..an all around nice guy, but bring coffee to class.
Likely the most intelligent professor I have had.  Is a virtual encyclopedia on everything relating to the course and is extremely passionate about his interests
No Comments

Very drab. Has the voice of Ben Stein. Intelligent but relies on strenuous non-stop babble RATHER than the preferred short answer. Never ask a question that you are not prepared to listen to him answer for half an hour.
he is very knowledgable in the fiesl of metnal disorder

Class was a tad disorganized (just like him) but once you listen up to what he has to say you realize just how brilliant he is.  he expects the same brilliance out of his students.  I thought it was great class.  Very sociological

Not very good from my perspective - Simon Verdun-Jones looks at this subject with case law, from a lawyer's point of view - Menzies trots out the academic articles on mental disorder and the DSM IV, III, probably XVIII by now.
Yes, neurotic in a strange mad hatter type way, i found it more amusing than anything. Like the class, didn't think it was too hard, thought he was a great guy.
very unclear at lectures, readings are very irrelevant to lecture and exams and midterms are very hard
crappiest teaching organization ever. hard(and lots) to read book for a 100 level course.
He's kinda neurotic but funny at the same time.  The material is pretty basic and the assignments aren't too tough - it's nice just as an elective even if you're not a crim student.
hes funny...plays music before lecture starts and during the break.  ORGANIZED!!!
Very animated and entertaining, overall nice guy...covers a lot of material, but the notes provided are sparse.
boring, dull, never gets to the point!
Boring as hell, but you have to love him!
Moves around to much in class. Works very hard for his students
No Comments
No Comments
difficult but worth it; v. fair & v. knowledgable. great guy
No Comments
The best Prof! Very critical, extremely intelligent, the man reads everything!
leads to critical thinking, excellent
tonnes of readings
What's up with his lecture voice?! He sounds like a sheep!
helpful, caring, expects a lot
Great prof - quirky, but funny!
hard exams
